title: SB 1159
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The Legislature aims to make cost, quality, and equity data available to promote innovative healthcare approaches in California. This includes using a data atlas to assess healthcare needs, control costs, improve quality, reduce disparities, increase transparency, and enhance health outcomes for all populations. The California Health and Human Services Agency is researching the development of a cost, quality, and equity data atlas to increase transparency in healthcare costs and delivery efficiency. This initiative aims to promote innovative programs for disease management, wellness, prevention, and efficient utilization of prescription drugs and technology. The goal is to reduce unnecessary healthcare costs and educate consumers on healthcare information. The California Health and Human Services Agency is researching the development of a cost, quality, and equity data atlas to increase transparency in healthcare costs. This includes identifying key data submitters and comparing models from other states for inclusion in the atlas. The California Health and Human Services Agency is researching the development of a cost, quality, and equity data atlas to increase transparency in healthcare costs. This involves a comparative analysis of potential models used in other states and determining additional information to include in the atlas, such as data from health care service plans, insurers, and pricing information for health care items and services. The cost, quality, and equity data atlas being developed by the California Health and Human Services Agency will include information on social determinants of health, clinical data from various healthcare providers, governance structures, and funding approaches. The California Health and Human Services Agency is developing a cost, quality, and equity data atlas. Recommendations on funding approaches, consultation with stakeholders, and making research results public by March 1, 2017, are key components of the project. The agency may use federal funds for this purpose.
